page.title: 10The Sports Council
page.content: The Sports Council was formed in Sept. 1983. The Council was formed by 2 councillors and 2 outsiders, because there was no sports for children in the winter months. The Sports Council organise 5 a side, badminton, table tennis and swingball. In the future they hope to organise hockey, volley ball and short tennis. The Market Hall is open on Tuesdays for anybody who wants to play any games that the Council organises. To get in it is 30p for children for one and a half hours. On Thursdays the Market Hall is used by the Ellesmere B.M.X. club. They want competitions and tournaments. In the winter months they are going to encourage the cricket club to train there. They are holding sponsored events to raise money for a pavillion on the Beech Grove playing fields.
